summary:
The future belongs to all of us, after all, its the place where we will spend most of our time. I help you to create and shape your future. By exploring the threads connecting ratio & intuition, science & design and nature & technology I challenge you to identify what truly matters and live up to it. 

If you would like to know how to bring futures thinking in your life, feel free to connect.

In the curriculum, design-oriented principles are connected to trend & futures research.

Activities:
| Initiator & member of professorships Futures Research and Trendwatching (2013-2017) & Designing the Future (2019 onwards).
| Responsible for curriculum on futures & trend research.
| Member of the curriculum committee with the purpose of critically assessing the curriculum and advising involved lecturers.
| Initiator of new research projects, for example initializing a consortium for NWO call Complexity and Creative Industry in collaboration with, amongst others, Design Academy Eindhoven, Next Nature Network, Radboud University, Pakhuis de Zwijger, de Waag and TU Delft.', 'title': 'Senior lecturer trend & futures research ', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 164802, 'name': 'Maastricht University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQFA1gR1FvG8aQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1588059465102?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=GS0as2VwEDw7-R9Dp9mEUJxdykBIwgfhtdx_vvylGdc', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/maastricht-university/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Maastricht University', 'description': 'With my dissertation Becoming Futurists I reflect on the value of futurists, who break with conventions and give a glimpse of how professionals (want to) work in the future. 
Supervisors: prof.dr.ir. Marjolein van Asselt & prof.dr. Harro van Lente

Activities: 
• Presentations of findings at i.a. Harvard University, Nyenrode Business School and various other scientific conferences.
• Facilitator and host of several conferences and group discussions for involved networks in the Netherlands.
• Publication designed by Alt8 and cover art by Thomas Trum.', 'title': 'PhD Candidate', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Trend Research Lab', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Tilburg Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Trend Research Lab', 'description': 'With the Trend Research Lab, supported by Fontys Academy for Creative Industries, we introduce the future to young and old. We do this by offering a (physical) space for experimentation. In this setting, we advance our knowledge of the future together with local entrepreneurs, students, experts and neighbors. My role as co-founder was creative lead, I envisioned the idea and translated it into a physical space, and in so doing, I involved and connected relevant stakeholders.', 'title': 'Co-Founder', 'employment_type': None}]}]
